title: EIM12850 - Termination payments and benefits:the most common payments and benefits taxable in full

details.body:
The most common termination payments and benefits within [EIM12810](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM12800#EIM12810) which are taxable in full under Section 62 ITEPA 2003 are shown below.
### Type of payment ### Notes ### Guidance
A payment received under the terms and conditions of service. Such terms may be in the main contract document or elsewhere, for example in a staff handbook or letter of appointment. See example [EIM13920](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM12800#EIM13920).Most such payments are taxable under Section 62 ITEPA 2003 but exceptions are redundancy payments (see [EIM13750](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM12800#EIM13750)) and lump sums from pension schemes approved by IR SPSS (Nottingham).[EIM00610](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM00505#EIM00610) [EIM13920](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM12800#EIM13920)
A non-contractual payment that the employer is accustomed to make and/or that the employee could reasonably have expected to receive. [EIM00640](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM00505#EIM00640) [EIM12977](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM12850#EIM12977)
A payment made to induce an employee take up an employment.The payment is earnings (see [EIM00515](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM00505#EIM00515)) from the new employment.[EIM00700](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM00505#EIM00700)
See [EIM12950](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM12800#EIM12950) for information concerning payments made under the Employment Rights Act 1996
